docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 10 (UP) -- Dr. Manuel Ordonez, attorney for the owners of La Prensa, of Buenos Aires, expressed confidence today that the Argentine courts would return the newspaper to the Gainza Paz interests.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 10 (UP) -- Dr. Manuel Ordonez, attorney for the owners of La Prensa, of Buenos Aires, expressed confidence today that the Argentine courts would return the newspaper to the Gainza Paz interests.
docs.abstract: Dr Ordonez, atty for Gainza Paz interests, sees cts restoring Prensa to rightful owners

headline.main: LA PRENSA'S RETURN TO GAINZA PAZ SEEN

docs.snippet: THE fall of Gen. Juan Domingo Peron, for ten years dictator-President of Argentina, raises the perennial question: How stable is Latin America? The answer is that it certainly is more stable now than it was. Probably it is moving gradually toward a...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE fall of Gen. Juan Domingo Peron, for ten years dictator-President of Argentina, raises the perennial question: How stable is Latin America? The answer is that it certainly is more stable now than it was. Probably it is moving gradually toward a condition of greater stability than at any time.
docs.abstract: his article analyzes forces in Latin Amer pointing to continued and greater pol and econ stability; illus

headline.main: Latin America Moves Slowly Toward Stability; Under a sometimes turbulent surface, long-term economic and political forces are working a change.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 19 -- The General Assembly failed today to break the deadlock over a seat in the United Nations Security Council.

docs.snippet: The police of eleven states are hunting for the one or more miscreants who put a surprise ending to the wanderings of nine Colt pistols. This, according to Deputy Inspector Frederick M. Lussen in charge of Manhattan West detectives, is what happened:

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 20 -- The General Assembly today completed organization of the United Nations Economic and Social and Trusteeship Councils. The world body postponed for a week, however, the bitterly contested election for a seat on the...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 20 -- The General Assembly today completed organization of the United Nations Economic and Social and Trusteeship Councils. The world body postponed for a week, however, the bitterly contested election for a seat on the Security Council, the most powerful United Nations group except the Assembly itself.

headline.main: U.N. Completes 2 Councils; Security Body Vote Put Off; U.N. Fills Seats on Two Councils; Security Unit Fight Off a Week

byline.original: By LINDESAY PARROTTSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 26 -- Sixty-one nations pledged today a provisional total of $28,031,536 to the United Nations Technical Assistance Program of aid to underdeveloped countries. Statements by spokesmen for others of the seventy-six...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 26 -- Sixty-one nations pledged today a provisional total of $28,031,536 to the United Nations Technical Assistance Program of aid to underdeveloped countries. Statements by spokesmen for others of the seventy-six governments participating indicated that the total might reach $30,000,000 or more.
docs.abstract: UN tech aid pledging conf; 61 nations pledge record $28,031,536; 26 raise previous pledges; US proviso that combined gifts of other nations must equal its $15.5-million pledge linked

headline.main: U. N. AID PLEDGES SET NEW RECORD; $28,031,536 Promised by 61 Nations in Day -- 26 States Increase Contributions
